```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, tidy = TRUE)
```

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(p8105.datasets)
library(modelr)
```


Simulate two datasets,

```{r}
set.seed(1)

n_samp = 250

sim_df_const = 
  tibble(x = rnorm(n_samp, 1, 1),
         error = rnorm(n_samp, 0, 1),
         y = 2 + 3 * x + error)

sim_df_nonconst = 
  sim_df_const |> 
  mutate(
    error = .75 * error * x, 
    y = 2 + 3 * x + error
    )
```

Look at these data

```{r}
sim_df_nonconst |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y)) +
  geom_point()
  
```

What does `lm` do for these?

```{r}
sim_df_const |> 
  lm(y ~ x, data = _) |> 
  broom::tidy() |> 
  knitr::kable(digit = 3)

sim_df_nonconst |> 
  lm(y ~ x, data = _) |> 
  broom::tidy() |> 
  knitr::kable(digit = 3)
```
